item.title: How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
Before the NHL regular season begins, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting in September. We dusted off our skates to deliver a complete look at how to watch this year’s NHL preseason.

The post How To Watch the 2025 NHL Preseason appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

Before the puck drops on the 2025–2026 NHL regular season, each team will compete in a series of preseason matchups starting September 20, 2025. NHL Network and TNT will televise select games nationwide, but most preseason hockey action airs on regional sports networks (RSNs).

Stream with DIRECTV is my favorite service for catching the NHL preseason. It comes with every national NHL channel and offers most RSNs based on your location. But if you support a team far from home, you’ll want ESPN+ for out-of-market streaming access.

Keep reading for more info on NHL preseason channels and recommended TV services. We also have a section dedicated to the full preseason schedule so you can quickly check game times.

Jump to:

  • NHL preseason channels
  • NHL preseason TV schedule
  • Best NHL preseason TV plans
  • Watch the NHL preseason for free

Don’t miss preseason hockey on TV!

Score the best TV plan in your area by entering your zip code below.

What channels are NHL preseason games on?

NHL preseason channels are a bit of a mixed bag. Most games air locally on regional sports networks or stream with geo-restrictions on each team’s official website. NHL Network and TNT broadcast some matchups nationwide, and you can stream many out-of-market preseason games on ESPN+.

Want radio coverage? While not all NHL preseason games appear on TV, you can listen to game audio through team radio affiliates online via TuneIn.

2025 NHL preseason schedule

This year’s NHL preseason runs from September 21 to October 5. Like previous seasons, the two-week period includes neutral-site exhibition games happening domestically and internationally. Buffalo Sabres fans in Germany will get a special treat as the NHL Global Series makes a preseason stop at SAP Garden in Munich.

Best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason

The best TV plans for watching the NHL preseason depend on the games you wish to see. If you prefer having access to every preseason duel, you’ll want DIRECTV STREAM and ESPN+.

DIRECTV STREAM will get you every national NHL channel and your regional sports network, while ESPN+ provides out-of-market access. Together, DIRECTV STREAM with a standalone ESPN+ subscription is the most expensive route for NHL fans. It’s also unnecessary if you want only the televised games featuring your favorite team. In that case, you may look to one of these options:

  1. Local games: Watching locally televised NHL preseason games is tricky because every team has different TV affiliates. In most cases, you’ll need a TV provider like DIRECTV STREAM or Fubo to get RSN access. Otherwise, depending on your local team’s broadcaster, a simple TV antenna can pick up games over the air.
  2. Out-of-market games: ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice carry out-of-market NHL games. You won’t get every out-of-market preseason game because not every game airs on TV, but ESPN+ is a great streaming option for only $10.99 a month.
  3. National games: Sling TV is the cheapest way to get national NHL channels like ESPN, NHL Network, and TNT. All you’ll need is the Sling Orange plan ($45.99/mo.) and the Sports Extra add-on ($11.00/mo.).

Any TV plan offering NHL Network and TNT will get you nationally televised NHL preseason games. To help your search, we listed 13 popular TV services in the table below and illustrated whether they carry the two channels.

How to watch the NHL preseason for free

Unfortunately, no straightforward viewing methods exist to watch NHL preseason games for free. In some metropolitan areas with NHL teams, you might catch a few matchups using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna—such as KMCC in Las Vegas airing Vegas Golden Knights preseason games. However, this option is not viable for most NHL fans, especially if you don’t live near your favorite team.

While scouring Reddit for free NHL streams is possible, we don’t endorse that approach due to its illegality, unreliability, and potential risks to your streaming device. Instead, a legitimate and inexpensive option is subscribing to ESPN+ at $11.99 a month, which will provide access to many matchups with no additional commitments.

Are all NHL preseason games on TV?

Most NHL preseason games appear on TV or online, although some matchups may not have an official broadcast. Regional blackout restrictions can also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

For in-market coverage, you’ll need a TV plan with your local team’s regional sports network. You can also explore out-of-market options like ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice if you support a non-local team. In cases where no viewing option is available, games are typically still accessible through each team’s radio partner.

How to watch the NHL preseason FAQ

Can you stream NHL preseason games?

Yes, you can stream NHL preseason games on any live TV streaming service that offers NHL Network, TNT, and your local team’s RSN affiliate. ESPN+ also carries select out-of-market games during the preseason.

Are NHL preseason games blacked out?

Yes, broadcasting blackouts occur for all locally televised NHL preseason games. In-market games will appear on RSNs, while ESPN+ and NHL Center Ice will show some out-of-market matchups.

Does NHL Center Ice include preseason games?

Yes, NHL Center Ice carries select out-of-market preseason games. Unlike the regular season, NHL Center Ice doesn’t offer complete out-of-market access during the preseason. Blackout restrictions may also prevent certain games from airing in your area.

Where can I watch NHL preseason games in Canada?

In Canada, some NHL preseason games air nationally on Sportsnet, Sportsnet ONE, and TSN. Sportsnet+ (formerly Sportsnet NOW) will show select out-of-market preseason games, while in-market games may appear on TSN’s regional networks and individual team websites.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com sports editor, Taylor Kujawa, conducted thorough research and hands-on testing to identify the best ways to watch this year’s NHL preseason. He compiled a comprehensive list of preseason matchups and channel listings. Utilizing that data, he compared popular TV providers to determine the most efficient way to watch the most games—considering in-market, out-of-market, and nationally televised broadcasts.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

item.title: How To Watch Every Jurassic Park and Jurassic World Movie
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
From the 1993 classic to 2025’s Rebirth, here’s how to watch the Jurassic Park movies in order. Our guide reviews every film and tells you where to stream them.

The post How To Watch Every Jurassic Park and Jurassic World Movie appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Few films roar to life like the original Jurassic Park. Sure, the concept of Steven Spielberg adapting a Michael Crichton techno-thriller sounds like a guaranteed hit. But it’s the masterful execution across all departments that makes the film an enduring classic. From the groundbreaking blend of animatronics and CGI to the sweeping score, Jurassic Park set a new standard for blockbuster filmmaking.

Of course, the franchise didn’t stop there. With sequels, reboots, and even animated TV “sidequels,” the dino saga has been stomping across our screens for over 30 years. That evolution can make figuring out how to watch Jurassic Park a challenge, especially since the films and shows are often scattered across different streaming services.

But that’s where this guide comes in. I’ll walk you through the entire franchise, from the original movies to the latest TV shows. You’ll get my take on every installment, a clear viewing order, and direct links to where to stream each entry. Think of me as your park guide, just without the charisma of Mr. DNA.

Is your internet from the Cretaceous Period?

If your stream is buffering during a T. rex attack, your Wi-Fi might be a fossil. Enter your zip code below to find more reliable internet service near you.

Jurassic Park and Jurassic World watch order

Fortunately, figuring out the Jurassic Park viewing order is refreshingly simple. Unlike other sprawling franchises (ahem, X-Men), release order and chronological order are one and the same. That means you can follow the film-by-film list below without needing a complex timeline graphic.

List of Jurassic Park movies

  • Jurassic Park (1993)
  • The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)
  • Jurassic Park III (2001)
  • Jurassic World (2015)
  • Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)
  • Jurassic World Dominion (2022)
  • Jurassic World Rebirth (2025)

Looking for the hottest entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

Jurassic Park (1993)

Billionaire InGen CEO John Hammond (Richard Attenborough) has brought dinosaurs back from extinction on Isla Nublar, a remote island off Costa Rica’s Pacific coast. Before he can open his park to the public, he needs a crucial endorsement from three experts: paleontologists Alan Grant (Sam Neill) and Ellie Sattler (Laura Dern) and chaos theorist Ian Malcolm (Jeff Goldblum). Unfortunately for them, the main attractions have other plans.

Beyond the heart-pounding terror of an escaped T. rex, the film’s true magic is its perfect balance of sci-fi horror and genuine awe—a feat no sequel has fully recaptured. I particularly love its quiet moments, like Hammond’s flea circus monologue, where John Williams’ gentler themes bring the story’s wonder to life. Whether it’s your first time watching or your hundredth, all I gotta say is, hold onto your butts.

Where to stream Jurassic Park

Watch Options

The Lost World: Jurassic Park (1997)

In my favorite sequel of the series, The Lost World keeps the vibes of the original but cranks up the intensity and action. Jeff Goldblum’s Ian Malcolm returns to the spotlight, transforming the fast-talking mathematician into a bona fide action hero.

This time, the prehistoric mayhem moves to Isla Sorna (aka “Site B”). A new crew joins Malcolm for the mission, including paleontologist Sarah Harding (Julianne Moore) and documentarian Nick Van Owen (Vince Vaughn). They must face off against a ruthless team of mercenaries hoping to capture dinosaurs and ship them to a new theme park in San Diego.

Where to stream The Lost World: Jurassic Park

Watch Options

Jurassic Park III (2001)

The third installment brings Sam Neill’s Dr. Alan Grant back into the fold, lured by a seemingly wealthy couple who offer to fund his latest dig. They claim they just want an aerial tour of Isla Sorna (the island from the second film), but it’s all a lie.

For years, Jurassic Park III was called the black sheep of the franchise, but I’ve always had a soft spot for it. It’s a lean, 92-minute creature feature that ditches the deep themes for non-stop action, memorable new dinosaurs like the Spinosaurus, and a few gloriously bizarre moments (yes, I mean the talking raptor).

Where to stream Jurassic Park III

Watch Options

Jurassic World (2015)

More than a decade after the franchise went dormant, we return to the original Isla Nublar. Hammond’s dream is now a reality, as the fully operational dinosaur theme park, Jurassic World, is open for business. But with ticket sales getting stale, the park’s solution is to create a more insidious attraction from scratch: the Indominus rex. It’s a decision that goes about as well as you’d expect. This is where we meet the franchise’s new heroes, raptor-whisperer Owen Grady (Chris Pratt) and park manager Claire Dearing (Bryce Dallas Howard), kicking off the next chapter of chaos.

Jurassic World is a fun legacy sequel, though I’d stop short of calling it a great one. While it’s a thrill to see the park up and running, I’ve always found the film’s characters a bit generic. The story also didn’t go in the direction I expected the series to take after the 14-year wait.

Where to stream Jurassic World

Watch Options

Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom (2018)

Three years after the events of Jurassic World, Owen and Claire head back to Isla Nublar to rescue the dinosaurs from an erupting volcano. But the mission is just a setup for a sinister black-market auction at a Gothic mansion in Northern California.

I’ll admit, Fallen Kingdom doesn’t always hold up under a microscope. But I kind of love its darker thrills and preposterous story beats. I see it as The Lost World of the Jurassic World era, turning that film’s mainland climax into the main event with permanent consequences. And hey, who doesn’t love a dino-themed haunted house movie?

Where to stream Jurassic World: Fallen Kingdom

Watch Options

Pro tip: After Fallen Kingdom, be sure to watch the Battle at Big Rock (2019) short film on YouTube. There’s also a Dominion prologue (2021) worth watching next, but it’s also integrated into the Jurassic World Dominion Extended Version.

Jurassic World Rebirth (2025)

The box office has spoken, and it said the franchise isn’t extinct yet. This soft reboot introduces a new cast of characters led by Zora Bennett (Scarlett Johansson). They embark on a self-contained adventure to a dangerous, abandoned research island in the Atlantic.

I view Rebirth as a welcome step in the right direction. The movie ditches the sprawling, world-threatening plots of the last film to bring back more tense, horror-tinged action. While its “get in, get out” mission plot feels a bit familiar, it’s a pure popcorn flick with great visuals and memorable mayhem, making it a worthy successor to the original trilogy.

Where to stream Jurassic World Rebirth

Watch Options

How to watch the Jurassic World TV shows

Beyond the movies, the Jurassic universe now includes two animated series that are essential viewing for die-hard fans. The Annie Award-winning Jurassic World: Camp Cretaceous and its sequel, Chaos Theory, are both available to stream on Netflix. But you can also purchase Camp Cretaceous seasons from digital retailers like Apple TV and Fandango At Home.

These aren’t just cheap cash-ins, either. The shows are in good hands, with franchise veterans like Steven Spielberg, Colin Trevorrow, and Frank Marshall serving as executive producers. They also feature A-list voice talent, including Jenna Ortega, Glen Powell, and Isabella Rossellini.

Ultimately, these shows are where the series’ world-building truly shines. Keep scrolling for a closer look at each one.

List of Jurassic World TV shows

  • Jurassic World Camp Cretaceous (2020–2022)
  • Jurassic World: Chaos Theory (2024–2025)

Looking for the Lego shows? You can stream the kid-friendly Lego Jurassic World: The Secret Exhibit (2018) and Lego Jurassic World: Legend of Isla Nublar (2019) on Peacock. Both are fun, non-canon prequels to Jurassic World.

Jurassic World Camp Cretaceous (2020–2022)

This animated spinoff strands six teenagers at Isla Nublar’s Camp Cretaceous right as the events of the first Jurassic World unfold. What begins as a once-in-a-lifetime adventure quickly turns into a survival story, forcing the kids to rely on each other while dinosaurs roam free. Across five seasons, the show ties directly into the Jurassic World and Fallen Kingdom timelines, expanding the franchise’s lore in exciting ways.

I often think of Camp Cretaceous as the Jurassic version of Star Wars: The Clone Wars. If you can get past the sometimes-goofy CGI, you’ll find a surprisingly dark and compelling series that connects the dots between the films in a truly satisfying way.

Where to stream Jurassic World Camp Cretaceous

Watch Options

Jurassic World: Chaos Theory (2024–2025)

Picking up six years after Camp Cretaceous, Chaos Theory reunites members of the “Nublar Six” as young adults with a slightly more mature tone. The team is drawn into a dangerous mystery that sends them on the run as they unravel a shadowy dinosaur-smuggling network. But at the heart of it all is a personal mission to uncover the truth behind the suspicious death of one of their own.

For me, this series is essential viewing for fans of the Jurassic World films. It fully embraces the “dinos among us” theme, filling in crucial story gaps the movies couldn’t explore and giving more weight to key villains. Chaos Theory is a genuinely worthwhile bridge between Fallen Kingdom and Dominion.

Where to stream Jurassic World: Chaos Theory

Watch Options

How to watch Jurassic Park FAQ

Can you buy or rent Jurassic Park at home?

Yes, all Jurassic Park films are available to rent or buy from video-on-demand (VOD) retailers like Apple TV and Fandango At Home. For physical media collectors, the entire franchise is also widely available on DVD and Blu-ray, often in comprehensive box sets.

What is the correct way to watch Jurassic Park?

For first-time viewers, watching the Jurassic Park franchise in release order is the best approach. Each film builds upon the last in chronological order, exactly as the filmmakers intended. The two animated shows, Camp Cretaceous and Chaos Theory, are best saved for a rewatch, as they run parallel to the first three Jurassic World films.

Are the Jurassic Park and Jurassic World movies connected?

Yes, they’re directly connected, as the Jurassic World films are a sequel series that takes place decades after the original Jurassic Park. Honestly, I’ve always found the name change a bit unnecessary and wish they’d just kept the Jurassic Park title for the whole series.

What is the best movie in the Jurassic Park franchise?

Hands down, the original Jurassic Park is the best film in the franchise—and it’s not even close. The real debate is over the best sequel, where you’ll get a different answer from most fans. While my personal favorite is the B-movie fun of The Lost World, many fans hold 2015’s Jurassic World in high regard for showing us the park in full swing.

Which Jurassic Park movie is the least scary?

If you’re looking for more adventure than horror, the least scary movie in the franchise is Jurassic World Dominion. Just remember that all the Jurassic films are rated PG-13, so expect plenty of dino-chomping moments in each one.

Let’s start watching!

item.title: The Ultimate Guide To Watching the New York Yankees in 2025
item.dc:creator: Chantel Buchi
item.description:
Learn how to watch every New York Yankees game on TV this MLB season with our viewing guide: featuring game times, channel listings, and more.

The post The Ultimate Guide To Watching the New York Yankees in 2025 appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Stream Free on DIRECTV

I know you’re excited to watch the New York Yankees this postseason. They passed their first test by beating their biggest rivals, the Boston Red Sox, in the American League Wild Card series. Next comes the Division Series against the Toronto Blue Jays.

Which channels have New York Yankees games?

You can watch Yankees 2025 games on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, TBS, YES Network, Apple TV+, and Amazon Prime Video.

If you don’t live near New York or don’t get access to the regional sports network, YES Network, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch games aired on this RSN.

Yankees fans will want ESPN for Sunday Night Baseball games and the Aaron Judge–Shohei Ohtani matchup in June. You’ll also want to subscribe to Prime Video to watch 20+ in-market Yankees games and Apple TV+ to access various Friday Night Baseball matchups.

Need faster internet to support streaming live MLB games?

No Yankee fan wants their stream to pause in the middle of a tied ninth inning. Enter your zip code below to find the best internet providers near you.

And lastly, you can sign up for a free live TV streaming trial with DIRECTV STREAM, Fubo, and YouTube TV. Keep in mind that DIRECTV STREAM is the only live TV streaming service with the YES Network.

How to watch New York Yankees FAQ

What day is Opening Day for Yankees 2025?

Opening Day for the New York Yankees is on Thursday, March 27, at 3:05 p.m. ET against the Milwaukee Brewers. The home opener will air exclusively on ESPN.

How can I watch the Yankees games in 2025?

The New York Yankees 2025 regular season games will air on FOX, FS1, ESPN, MLB Network, TBS, and YES Network. Select regional games will stream on Amazon Prime Video, while some national matchups will appear on Apple TV+. If you support the Yankees far away from New York, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch the YES games outside the Yankees’ home TV market.

Can I watch New York Yankees games without cable?

You can stream New York Yankees 2025 regular season games without cable using a live TV streaming service like DIRECTV STREAM, the only live TV streaming service with YES Network. YouTube TV, Fubo, and Hulu + Live TV have most channels a Yankee fan will need to stream MLB games. And Apple TV+ will feature Friday Night Baseball.

item.title: My Must-Watch List: The Best Scary Shows Streaming Right Now
item.dc:creator: Sophie Hastings
item.description:
If you're ready to deep-dive into terror, these are the top-rated, must-watch scary TV shows I currently recommend streaming on all major platforms.

The post My Must-Watch List: The Best Scary Shows Streaming Right Now appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
Why I think TV is the new home of horror

As a TV expert, I can tell you that while a two-hour horror movie gives you jump scares and quick jolts, a prestige horror series allows the dread to truly set in. Shows build complex characters, weave multi-season mysteries, and stretch out that terrifying tension for weeks.

That’s why I am so obsessed with this current golden age of scary streaming. It’s hard to know which series are worth the 10+ hour commitment, but I’ve done the haunting homework for you.

Looking for even more picks? Don’t miss TV critic Randy Harward’s weekly What To Watch guide for the freshest streaming recs.

Looking for the hottest entertainment?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest TV event viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

1. The Haunting of Hill House (2018)

I always recommend starting with Mike Flanagan’s work, and this is his masterpiece. The Haunting of Hill House blends a classic ghost story with loads of devastating family trauma. It delivers atmosphere, incredible performances, and jump scares that still shake me, proving that horror can be both emotionally resonant and absolutely terrifying.

Where to watch The Haunting of Hill House

Watch Options

2. The Last of Us (2023)

This Emmy-winning Max series is one of the best shows I’ve seen in years, horror or otherwise. The Last of Us is less about the threat of monsters and more about relentless existential dread and tactical survival in a world gone wrong. The production quality is cinematic, making you feel the weight of every emotional and terrifying encounter. If you like high-concept horror, put this at the top of your list.

Where to watch The Last of Us

Watch Options

3. Yellowjackets (2021)

I love a show that sparks debate, and Yellowjackets is the best in the game right now. It brilliantly blends psychological horror with survival-thriller tropes and a deep-seated mystery. Not only that, but the show balances two terrifying timelines: a plane crash in the ’90s and the trauma of the survivors decades later. It’s wildly fun, perfectly acted, and demands a second viewing.

Where to watch Yellowjackets

Watch Options

4. American Horror Story (2011–present)

When I just want to dive into a vibe, I turn on AHS. This is the genre’s defining anthology for a reason. With a new setting, new characters, and a new nightmare every season, it has a flavor for every kind of horror fan. I usually start with the original Murder House (Season 1) or the wickedly fun Coven (Season 3) to ease my way in.

Where to watch American Horror Story

Watch Options

5. From (2022)

This is my pick for the horror-obsessed crowd—the Fan Freds who have seen it all. If you’re looking for a mysterious, claustrophobic scare that feels like Lost crossed with a creature feature, From is your next deep dive. Set in a mysterious town that traps all who enter and is stalked by terrifying nocturnal creatures, this series is a hidden gem you need to check out.

Where to watch From

Watch Options

The post My Must-Watch List: The Best Scary Shows Streaming Right Now appeared first on CableTV.com.

item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
The good times have returned to Comerica Park! Follow the Detroit Tigers on TV all season long with our unbeatable watch guide.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Detroit Tigers Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
I know Detroit Tigers fans are exhilarated about the Wild Card series win over the Cleveland Guardians. The Tigers earned a spot in the American League Division Series against the Seattle Mariners, and are just three more wins away from the Championship Series.

Keep it here throughout the postseason, where I’ll be updating the viewing options for every Detroit game as the team advances through the playoffs.

Jump to:

  • Detroit Tigers channels
  • Best ways to watch the Tigers
  • Detroit Tigers TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Detroit Tigers games?

When the Detroit Tigers aren’t playing in front of national audiences on Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, FS1, and MLB Network, fans can watch their games on FanDuel Sports Network Detroit (FDSDET).

If FDSDET is unavailable where you live, you’ll need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to watch out-of-market Tigers games.

Want radio coverage? You can listen to every Tigers game on 97.1 FM The Ticket or an affiliate near you. Spanish broadcasts are also available for home games on LaZ 1310 AM and 107.9 FM.

Best TV plans for watching the Detroit Tigers

Outside of streaming-exclusive games on Apple TV+, only a few TV providers carry all the channels local fans need to watch every Detroit Tigers game this season. Of the options, my top pick is Fubo. Its Pro plan—the most affordable package Fubo offers—has everything you need. This means you don’t have to upgrade or get any add-ons to watch your Tigers, but you’ll have a regional sports fee for FDSDET access.

If you prefer a more traditional provider, DIRECTV is a good option. It has all the channels the Tigers will play on, but you’ll need to sign up for the Choice package to get FanDuel Sports Network. This will cost about $5 more per month than Fubo before any regional sports fees.

Unsure which one to pick? Take advantage of the free streaming trials both providers offer to find the one that’s best for you.

Standalone in-market TV package for Tigers games

If you’re a local fan who doesn’t want a full-blown TV provider to watch the Tigers in 2025, a subscription to FanDuel Sports Network is the way to go. This will let you watch every regular-season game that isn’t nationally televised. After subscribing, you can watch games online or in the FanDuel Sports Network app.

Score the best TV plan!

Want to browse more TV options? Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Detroit Tigers FAQ

Can I watch the Detroit Tigers for free?

Yes, you can watch the Detroit Tigers for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on national channels. Use the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to find the channels that are available where you live.

Are Detroit Tigers games available on Amazon Prime Video?

Yes, most Detroit Tigers games are available on Prime Video through add-on channels. Local fans need to buy the FanDuel Sports Network add-on, while out-of-market fans must purchase the MLB.TV add-on. Additionally, the Tigers–Yankees matchup on September 10 will stream on Prime Video at no extra cost for Prime subscribers who live in the Yankees’ TV market.

Will Tigers games be on ESPN after the 2025 season?

Possibly. Major League Baseball and ESPN previously announced that they would not renew their media rights deal after the 2025 season, but recent reports indicate the two sides are now discussing a possible extension.

Is there a FanDuel Sports Network app?

Yes, there is a FanDuel Sports Network app for streaming Tigers games. It’s available on Apple and Android devices, as well as several different streaming platforms.

Why you should trust us

Our CableTV.com Contributing Writer, David Vick, created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Detroit Tigers fans in mind. After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Tigers’ 2025 season, he determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, David carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • MLB.TV Review
  • How To Watch the Detroit Lions
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season
item.dc:creator: Ian McLaren
item.description:
Learn how to watch Toronto Blue Jays baseball on TV with our guide, featuring game times, channel listings, and streaming options.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Toronto Blue Jays Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
In professional sports, few things are more frustrating than unfulfilled potential, and Toronto Blue Jays fans have felt that sting more than once in recent years. Despite a talented core and multiple playoff appearances from 2015 to 2023, the team never managed to make a deep postseason run. Big expectations often turned into big letdowns.

Then came 2025, and the Blue Jays turned out to be one of the best teams in the Show.

Toronto won 94 games and earned a spot in the American League Divisional Series. The Blue Jays will play the winner of the Wild Card series between the Boston Red Sox and New York Yankees.

If you’re a Toronto fan who’s been itching to see if the Blue Jays can make a deep playoff run this year, I’ll show you how you can catch every playoff game on TV.

Jump to:

  • Toronto Blue Jays channels
  • Toronto Blue Jays TV schedule
  • Best Toronto Blue Jays TV plans

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Toronto Blue Jays games?

How to watch in the United States

In the U.S., Toronto Blue Jays games are available out-of-market via MLB.TV, since U.S. viewers don’t fall within the Canadian blackout territory.

Nationally televised games (on channels like ESPN, FOX, FS1, and TBS) are available to U.S. fans via live TV providers or streaming services. But MLB.TV doesn’t include those live broadcasts.

How to watch in Canada

In Canada, the Toronto Blue Jays are exclusively broadcast through Sportsnet and its related feeds like Sportsnet One and Sportsnet 360. The network covers nearly every game throughout the regular season and postseason.

For French-speaking fans, TVA Sports (via a sub-licensing arrangement with Sportsnet) carries French-language broadcasts of Blue Jays games and some national MLB content in Canada.

Occasional Friday night Blue Jays games are exclusive to Apple TV+, which aren’t available through Sportsnet or Sportsnet+.

Want radio coverage? The Blue Jays’ flagship radio station is Sportsnet 590 The Fan (CJCL AM 590) in Toronto, with coverage available across southern Ontario. It simulcasts most games and is carried on satellite and digital platforms.

2025 Toronto Blue Jays playoff TV schedule

The Blue Jays finished in first place in the AL East this season. They’ll put that gaudy record to the test in the best-of-five Divisional Series starting Saturday, October 4 against the New York Yankees.

Below is the full schedule for the ALDS as it’s currently known. I’ll update it as soon as more information comes out.

Best TV plans for watching the Toronto Blue Jays

Canada: Score a standalone in-market TV package for Blue Jays games

If you’re a local fan in Canada who wants to stream games without a cable package, Sportsnet+ is your best bet. A subscription gives you access to nearly every regular-season Blue Jays game that isn’t nationally televised. Once subscribed, you can watch online or via the Sportsnet app on your preferred device.

Just don’t forget to add Apple TV+ to your setup if you want to catch the exclusive Friday Night Baseball games, which often feature the Blue Jays. That applies to fans in both Canada and the U.S.

United States: Get MLB.TV and a live TV service

For U.S.-based fans looking to watch the Toronto Blue Jays throughout the 2025 season, the most complete and convenient setup is a combination of MLB.TV and a live TV streaming service.

MLB.TV is the best way to watch nearly every Blue Jays game, since they’re considered an out-of-market team in the U.S. This means you can stream all regular-season games live or on demand, with the exception of those that air nationally on channels like ESPN or FOX.

To cover those national broadcasts, services like Fubo, DIRECTV, or Sling TV are your best bets.

  • Fubo: A top choice for sports fans, Fubo offers access to ESPN, FOX, FS1, and more, along with the option to integrate your MLB.TV subscription directly into the platform for a seamless viewing experience.
  • DIRECTV: DIRECTV’s streaming option also offers full access to national channels and supports MLB.TV as an add-on, making it a solid traditional alternative.
  • Sling TV: For a more budget-friendly approach, Sling TV with both the Orange and Blue packages plus the Sports Extra add-on gives you access to ESPN, TBS, FS1, and MLB Network. Keep in mind you’ll need to manage MLB.TV separately.

Find the best service in your area

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers.

How to watch the Toronto Blue Jays FAQ

How can I watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free?

To watch the Toronto Blue Jays for free, your best bet is to sign up for a Sportsnet+ free trial in Canada, or a Fubo or DIRECTV free trial in the U.S. for nationally televised games. You can also check MLB.TV’s Free Game of the Day, which occasionally features the Blue Jays at no cost.

How can American viewers watch the Blue Jays most effectively?

In the U.S., the best way to watch the Blue Jays is with MLB.TV, which includes nearly every out-of-market game. Pair it with Apple TV+ for Friday exclusives and a live TV service (like Fubo or Sling TV) for games on ESPN, FOX, FS1, or MLB Network. This combo ensures full-season coverage.

Why should American fans care about the only MLB team north of the border?

The Blue Jays feature a star-studded lineup with names like Vladimir Guerrero Jr. and Bo Bichette, plus they’re constant playoff contenders. Their games often feature thrilling matchups against top AL East rivals—and the newly renovated Rogers Centre is one of baseball’s most unique ballparks.

Why you should trust us

As an Ontario resident, lifelong Blue Jays fan, and a Sportsnet subscriber who also has Apple TV+ for the Friday games, I understand firsthand the challenges of navigating MLB broadcast options.

I’ve used that experience to make this guide as helpful and practical as possible for fellow Jays fans.

I created this watch guide with the specific viewing needs of Toronto Blue Jays fans in mind.

After spending a few hours researching the most up-to-date broadcast schedule for the Blue Jays’ 2025 season, I determined the most ideal and affordable viewing options for fans. Before publishing, I carefully reviewed every detail in this guide to ensure its accuracy and completeness.

Check out CableTV.com’s How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.

Game day starts here!

  • How To Watch CFL Games
  • Best Streaming Services for Sports

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 Seattle Mariners Season
item.dc:creator: David Vick
item.description:
Will this season be a home run for the Mariners? Learn how to watch Seattle Mariners baseball with our guide, featuring their TV schedule and channel lineup.

The post How To Watch the 2025 Seattle Mariners Season appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
How hard is it to make the MLB playoffs when you play in the American League? Just ask the Seattle Mariners. Since 2001, they’ve had 11 winning seasons. Yet only one of those led to a playoff appearance.

But the Mariners managed to make 2025 a successful season after qualifying for the American League Divisional Series. They start play Saturday, October 4 against the Cleveland Guardians.

Even though the matchup and times of the ALDS are yet to be announced, I’ve put together a watch guide for this round of the playoffs and beyond with what we know so far. Keep checking back on this page as more information becomes available.

Jump to:

  • Seattle Mariners channels
  • Best ways to watch the Mariners
  • Seattle Mariners TV schedule

Want more TV sports coverage?

Subscribe to CableTV.com’s email newsletter for the latest event-viewing guides, entertaining takes, and money-saving promotions.

By signing up, you agree to our Privacy Policy & Terms and Conditions.

What channels have Seattle Mariners games?

ROOT SPORTS is the regional home for Seattle Mariners broadcasts in 2025. Apple TV+, ESPN, FOX, MLB Network, and The Roku Channel will also televise a handful of Mariners games.

Out-of-market fans who want to watch regional broadcasts this year will need MLB.TV or MLB EXTRA INNINGS to do so.

Want radio coverage? The Mariners Radio Network offers listening options to fans in Washington, Oregon, Idaho, Alaska, and British Columbia. Fans in those states and Montana can also listen to games on the Seattle Sports 710 AM app or the Seattle Sports website.

Spanish-language audio is available for all Mariners home games through SAP channels on most of the cable and satellite providers that carry the ROOT SPORTS channel.

Best TV plans for watching the Seattle Mariners

Mariners fans in the Pacific Northwest have two excellent viewing options for the 2025 MLB season: a direct-to-consumer (DTC) package or a standard TV provider. I’ll go over the positives of each to help make your viewing decision easier.

ROOT SPORTS Stream ($19.99/mo.)

If you think you need a cable or satellite subscription to watch the Mariners on TV in 2025, think again. ROOT SPORTS Stream—the exclusive DTC viewing option for local fans—broadcasts almost every game the Mariners will play this season. The monthly price is unbeatable, and you can watch games on the app or online while traveling outside the Mariners’ TV market for up to 30 days. This is what I call a winning deal!

Fubo ($14.99–$94.99/mo.)

Not many TV providers carry ROOT SPORTS in their channel lineup. Luckily, Fubo does. If you’re an in-market fan, all you need is a good internet connection and a compatible device to subscribe.

The main drawback to watching local Mariners games on a TV provider is the regional sports fee, and Fubo isn’t very transparent about this extra cost. Aside from that, there’s a lot to like about Fubo, including its unlimited recording capabilities. That comes in handy during a 162-game season.

Score the best TV plan!

Enter your zip code below to see your area’s top TV providers

2025 Seattle Mariners TV schedule

The Mariners kicked off the season with a home win in front of 42,871 passionate fans. Although it took until early April to win their first series, they’ve been playing solid baseball ever since, and earned a spot in the ALDS.

Seattle will face the Detroit Tigers starting Saturday, October 4. This best-of-five series should be exciting. Check out the full schedule below. I’ll update as more information becomes available.

How to watch the Seattle Mariners FAQ

Can I watch the Seattle Mariners for free?

Yes, you can watch the Seattle Mariners for free with an over-the-air antenna when games air on channels like FOX. Check out the FCC’s Reception Map Tool to find the channels that are available where you live.

Is ROOT SPORTS a regional sports network?

Yes, ROOT SPORTS is a regional sports network that provides coverage to fans in Washington, Oregon, Montana, Alaska, and parts of Idaho.

What channel is ROOT SPORTS on?

The channel that ROOT SPORTS is on depends on your TV provider and your location. Use the ROOT SPORTS Channel Finder tool to see which channel you can watch Mariners games on.

Where can I download the ROOT SPORTS Stream app?

You can download the ROOT SPORTS Stream app on Apple and Android devices, as well as several other streaming platforms and smart TVs.

Are the Mariners playing on Sunday Night Baseball in 2025?

Yes, the Mariners are playing on ESPN’s Sunday Night Baseball in 2025. They’ll be facing the Mets in the MLB Little League Classic on Sunday, August 17.

Why you should trust us

I created this watch guide after nearly four hours of research into the Seattle Mariners’ 2025 broadcast schedule. It includes every channel the Mariners will play on this MLB season, ways to watch the team, their full regular-season schedule, and a detailed FAQ section.

Learn more about CableTV.com’s methods by checking out our How We Rank page.

item.title: How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs
item.dc:creator: Taylor Kujawa
item.description:
ABC, FOX, FS1, TBS, ESPN, and ESPN2 are home to MLB postseason games, and we’ve outlined the best TV providers for tuning in.

The post How To Watch the 2025 MLB Playoffs appeared first on CableTV.com.
item.content:encoded:
The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin on Tuesday, September 30, and culminate with the 121st edition of the World Series, which starts Friday, October 24. You can watch playoff games on popular baseball channels from ESPN, FOX Sports, and TNT Sports, though channel lineups vary across each round.

American League fans should have FOX and FS1 locked and loaded for key matchups. However, National League followers will need access to TNT Sports channels like TBS and truTV, or a subscription to HBO Max, to catch that side of the postseason bracket.

Scroll down to see which TV providers carry these channels and how you can watch some playoff action for free.

Jump to:

  • MLB Playoffs channels
  • MLB Playoffs schedule
  • Watch the MLB Playoffs for free

Get the most MLB action on TV!

Enter your zip code below to browse your area’s top TV and internet providers.

What channels are the MLB Playoffs on?

The 2025 MLB Playoffs will likely air across six channels, based on last year’s schedule:

  • ABC
  • FOX
  • FS1
  • TBS
  • truTV
  • ESPN
  • ESPN2

Most MLB playoff channels are easy to find from various TV providers, but you may need a higher-tier TV plan to access specific networks. Additionally, ESPN Deportes, Fox Deportes, MLB Network, truTV, UniMás, and Univision will carry Spanish-language postseason coverage.

Pro tip: All games airing on TBS and TNT will stream on HBO Max’s Standard and Premium plans. But it’s important to note that you might not need every playoff channel listed above—especially if you’re only tuning in for a specific team.

MLB Playoffs TV schedule

The 2025 MLB Playoffs begin in late September, starting with the Wild Card Series. After that, the action moves to the divisional and league series. The 121st World Series begins in late October.

See the first table below to find out when each series starts and on what channels you can watch them. For a more comprehensive look at each series, click on the drop-down menus a little further down. I’ll be updating the schedules as the postseason unfolds.

Best TV plans for watching the MLB Playoffs

Now that you know the channels you’ll need to watch this year’s playoffs, you have a better idea of what to look for when choosing a TV provider. But we’ll make it a step easier. Here’s a list of our three favorite postseason TV plans.

  • Antenna: You can catch every playoff game airing on ABC and FOX using an over-the-air (OTA) antenna, as long as you’re within range of a local affiliate station. Check out our Watch For Free section below for more on this viewing option.
  • Sling TV + Antenna: Sling TV is the most affordable option for watching the MLB Playoffs because its Sling Orange + Blue plan offers FS1, TBS, and ESPN for just $60.99/mo.. While it lacks nationwide coverage for ABC and FOX, you can still stream ABC games through ESPN3 and use an antenna for FOX broadcasts.
  • YouTube TV: At $82.99/mo., YouTube TV is an excellent service for streaming the MLB Postseason. You’ll get every playoff channel and sick features like multiview and unlimited DVR storage. We typically don’t recommend YouTube TV during the MLB regular season because it lacks MLB Network and crucial regional sports networks. But that won’t affect your viewing experience during the playoffs.

CableTV.com utilizes paid Amazon links. Amazon.com Price; $46.99 (as of 7/25/25 11:20 a.m. CT). Read full disclaimer.

Because the MLB Playoffs air across several basic cable networks, you’ll need a TV subscription to access the entire slate of playoff games. Some live TV streaming services offer free trials, but most don’t last longer than seven days.

You can watch a slice of playoff action without subscribing to a TV plan using an OTA antenna on your smart TV. Since ABC and FOX air various playoff games, you can tune in for free through your local network affiliates. That’s especially important since FOX will show the complete World Series.

If you need a high-quality antenna, we suggest checking out the Mohu Leaf 50. It’s one of our favorite antennas because of its 60-mile range and 4K capabilities. Though, you’ll want to enter your zip code on the FCC’s Reception Map Tool before committing to an antenna. That way, you can ensure ABC and FOX stations are within range of your home.

How to watch the MLB Playoffs FAQ

What app can I watch the MLB Playoffs on?

If you already have access to MLB playoff channels through a TV provider, you can watch live games through individual channel apps like ESPN, FOX Sports, and TBS. All you need to do is sign in to each app with your TV provider credentials. You can also watch the MLB Playoffs through the MLB app, but you’ll need an eligible TV provider login for live game access.

How can I watch the MLB Playoffs without cable?

Without cable, you can watch the entire MLB Playoffs through most live TV streaming services. We recommend Sling TV because it’s the cheapest way to get ESPN, FS1, and TBS in one plan (Sling Orange + Blue at $60.99/mo.), but you’ll likely need an antenna for FOX coverage.

Does Amazon Prime have the MLB Playoffs?

No, a basic Amazon Prime Video subscription doesn’t include nationally televised MLB games like the MLB Playoffs. But you can watch some MLB coverage through Prime Video using add-ons like HBO Max Standard and MLB.TV.

What is the new format for the MLB Playoffs?

The current postseason format launched in 2022 when the MLB expanded to a six-team American League and National League playoff bracket. Now, the Wild Card round is a best-of-three series instead of a single-elimination game, and the top two division winners of each league receive byes into the Division Series. Check out the MLB’s Postseason Format Explainer for a closer look at how it all works.

Why you should trust us

Our baseball experts researched the best ways to watch the MLB Playoffs by comparing the most popular TV providers head to head. We based our viewing recommendations primarily on ease of use—focusing on each provider’s channel lineups, pricing, and set-up process.

Check out our How We Rank page to learn more about our methods.
